roles.title: Roles
roles.description: Manage the roles in your team.

confirmDelete.title: Delete Role
confirmDelete.description: Are you sure you want to delete this role? This action cannot be undone and will remove the role from all members.

toasts.roleAddedErrorDescription: The role {name} could not be added.
toasts.roleAddedErrorNullDescription: The role could not be added because the name or color is empty.
toasts.roleDeletedErrorDescription: The role could not be deleted.

members.title: Members
members.description: Manage the members and their roles in this team.

confirmRemoveMember.title: Remove Member
confirmRemoveMember.description: Are you sure you want to remove this member? This action cannot be undone.

toasts.memberRemovedErrorDescription: The member could not be removed.
toasts.rolesUpdatedErrorDescription: The roles could not be updated.

tasks.couldNotFoundSelectedTask: The selected task could not be found.

toasts.taskCompletedDescription: The task was successfully completed and removed from your list.

editor.title: Processes
editor.cannotEditProcessesDialogDescription: Editing processes is not possible on narrow screens. Please use a device with a wider screen.
editor.createProcessDescription: Create a new process model for your team.
editor.name: Process Name

save.saveErrorDescription: The process could not be saved.

instance.createNewInstanceDescription: Create a new instance of the process.
instance.instanceAPIExplanation: You can also send a POST request to this URL to create a new instance:

toasts.instanceCreatedErrorDescription: The instance could not be created.

delete.deleteProcessDescription: Are you sure you want to delete this process? This action cannot be undone. All data associated with this process will also be deleted.

toasts.processCreatedErrorDescription: The process could not be created.

step-info.title: Welcome to the Node Creator
step-info.subtitle: This wizard will guide you through creating a new node for your business process. Follow the four simple steps below to configure your node.

general-details.title: 1. General Details
general-details.description: Define the basic information about your node, including name, description, and documentation.

options.title: 2. Options
options.description: Create the input fields, selections, and other options that users will interact with.

server-setup.title: 3. Server Setup
server-setup.description: Configure the server URL for your backend implementation.

code-templates.title: 4. Code Templates
code-templates.description: Get ready-to-use code templates for your backend implementation that you can copy and customize.

step-general-info.title: General Node Information
step-general-info.subtitle: Define the basic details of your node

short-description.label: Short Description
short-description.placeholder: Brief description of what this node does

documentation.title: Documentation
documentation.label: Documentation (Markdown)
documentation.help-text: Use Markdown syntax to format your documentation. This will be displayed to users when they view details about this node.

step-general-info.info-note: The information you provide here will be displayed to users when they browse available nodes. Make sure to provide clear and concise descriptions to help users understand what your node does.

step-options-config.title: Node Options Configuration
step-options-config.subtitle: Configure the options and fields that users will interact with
step-options-config.no-options: No options added yet. Use the dropdown above to add options to your node.

option-types-info.title: Options define how users will interact with your node:
option-types-info.input-textarea: Use Input and Textarea for simple text input
option-types-info.variable-name-input: Use VariableNameInput for naming data objects which will contain the results from the node
option-types-info.select: Use Select for dropdown menus with predefined options and SelectWithCustom for dropdown menus where the user can add his own values
option-types-info.row-separator: Use Row and Separator to group options together.

step-server-config.title: Server Configuration
step-server-config.subtitle: Configure the server URL and get code templates for your implementation

server-url.title: Server URL Configuration
server-url.label: Server URL
server-url.help-text: This is the URL where your server will receive requests from the workflow engine.

important-note.title: Important
important-note.content: Your server must be publicly accessible and able to receive POST requests. Make sure to implement proper error handling and response formatting.

templates.title: Server Implementation Templates
templates.subtitle: These templates help you implement the server-side functionality for your node. They are not executed within this application - they're just for reference.

notes.note1: Your server must respond quickly to avoid timeouts (return 200 immediately)
notes.note2: Process the request asynchronously and send the result to the provided response path
notes.note3: Always include the flowElementInstanceId in your responses
notes.note4: Handle errors gracefully and send them to the errorResponsePath
notes.note5: The server must be accessible from the internet
